messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Digest Number 2608
messages.msgSnippet: ... My kids came home with a bunch of those in their Halloween candy. The tracts talked about when else do you get children on your doorstep you can talk to
messages.messageBody:
On 7 Nov 02, at 12:47, Julie Stauffer wrote:

> <<I know in the past, fundamentalist have targeted children. To me
> that is reprehensible.>>
>
> The San Antonio Express-News had a big article about the "to do
> Halloween or not do Halloween" rift in the Christian community. One
> of the local Christian book stores was selling Halloween packets with
> good success. The packets were religious tracts to be handed out to
> trick or treaters. I gagged.
>
> Julie
>
My kids came home with a bunch of those in their Halloween
candy. The tracts talked about when else do you get children on
your doorstep you can talk to about Jesus. Can you imagine the
fuss if Stanists or Witches did the same thing!

Shyrley


"You laugh at me because I'm different. I laugh at you because you are all the same."

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Digest Number 2608
messages.msgSnippet: The San Antonio Express-News had a big article about the to do
messages.messageBody:
<<I know in the past, fundamentalist have targeted children. To me that is
reprehensible.>>

The San Antonio Express-News had a big article about the "to do Halloween or
not do Halloween" rift in the Christian community. One of the local
Christian book stores was selling Halloween packets with good success. The
packets were religious tracts to be handed out to trick or treaters. I
gagged.

Julie
